information: Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: About 2–3 months (result known on fight night at UFC 316)
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Fight proceeds as scheduled and Dvalishvili wins a wrestling-heavy decision after sustained pressure and control.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: O’Malley withdraws and is replaced, or he fights and knocks out Dvalishvili on an entry, or the bout is canceled/postponed such that they don’t face each other at UFC 316.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Dvalishvili chains takedowns, corrals O’Malley to the fence, racks up control time, and wins by decision or late TKO via ground-and-pound.
forecast.rationale:
Baseline: Merab Dvalishvili is the reigning bantamweight champion on a long win streak, coming off a unanimous decision over Umar Nurmagomedov in Jan 2025. That implies top form and consistency. His style—relentless pace, chain wrestling, top control—matches well against O’Malley’s rangy counter-striking, especially over five rounds. The first meeting (this is billed as “2”) likely went Merab’s way given his current title status and streak, which supports him being a small favorite again.

Key uncertainties: O’Malley has genuine one-shot finishing threat and strong shot selection, particularly intercepting opponents as they enter. He’s an elite striker with reach, feints, and footwork that can punish predictable level changes. Rematches also come with adjustment risk: O’Malley could refine takedown defense, stance/footwork patterns, and counters (knees/uppercuts) to deter entries. That prevents a runaway probability for Merab even if he’s favored.

Logistics risk: The question resolves No if they don’t fight each other at UFC 316. UFC main-event/change risk over a 2–3 month window is non-trivial (injury, illness, replacement). Merab has reported minor finger and toe issues; he intends to compete, but even small injuries slightly raise pull-out probability. I assign a roughly mid-teens chance the matchup changes or falls through. This pushes the overall Yes probability down from Merab’s in-cage edge.

Why not higher: O’Malley’s KO equity, rematch adjustments, and the non-zero chance the fight doesn’t happen or opponent changes at UFC 316. Why not lower: Merab’s proven cardio and wrestling volume, prior success (implied by his status), and stylistic advantages over five rounds give him a clear and repeatable path to win if the fight occurs.

What would move me up: Confirmed clean bill of health for Merab close to fight week; strong reports/footage of O’Malley struggling with sustained wrestling pressure in camp; betting markets moving toward Merab (e.g., to ~65%+ implied). What would move me down: Credible reports of Merab’s injuries hampering grappling entries or grip; O’Malley demonstrating markedly improved TDD and clinch exits; market movement toward O’Malley; any increase in cancellation/withdrawal signals.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Merab Dvalishvili defeat Sean O'Malley at UFC 316?

Question background:
ESPN: [UFC 316: Dvalishvili vs. O'Malley 2](https://www.espn.com/mma/fightcenter/_/id/600053672/league/ufc)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Dvalishvili does not fight anyone at UFC 316 or fights someone else, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
